meanings.definition: Make (something, typically the skin) thoroughly clean.
meanings.sent1: I cleanse my face every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: She uses a special soap to cleanse her hands after gardening.
meanings.sent3: After playing in the mud, the kids had to cleanse themselves before entering the house.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped cleanse the streets of dirt and grime.
meanings.sent5: The purification ritual involved a ceremonial cleanse of the body in the river.

meanings.definition: Rid (a person, place, or thing) of something seen as unpleasant, unwanted, or defiling.
meanings.sent1: He wanted to cleanse his mind of negative thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The sage was believed to cleanse the house of evil spirits.
meanings.sent3: The superhero used his powers to cleanse the city of crime.
meanings.sent4: Her apology helped cleanse the tension between them.
meanings.sent5: The spring rain helped cleanse the air of pollutants.
